Wonderful story! Satisfying gameplay, glourious world, great background details. Haven't tried DLCs yet but the main story gave me the idea that they are great also so I bought all the package. I recommend this game to all of my friends who enjoy FPS game dynamics and bored of the standard shot-and-continue game formula. Even though the game is a bit old, the different graphic style of the game is still mesmerizing. I played and finished the main story of this game 7 years ago and I recently started to play it again and I can say that it is still enjoyable!

2017년 겨울에 1번, 2021년 여름에 1번 총 2번을 한 게임이다. 게임의 ㄱ도 모르며 살던 내가 처음 한 게임이 불행인지 다행인지 이 명작 바이오쇼크 인피니트였다. 

진짜 처음 완주했을 때의 감동은 어마어마했다. 결말 보고서도 이해 못한 멍청이인 나는... 그래서 결말이 뭔데 하고 코 후비며 해설 찾아봤다가 엄청 충격에 빠졌던 기억이 난다. 위쳐도 드라마화 되는 마당에 인문학과 과학을 넘나드는 이 대대대명작을 왜 드라마나 영화로 안 만드는 건지 도통 알 수가 없다. 

그 이후 이 게임 덕분에 나는 스팀게임을 들락거리며 둘러보는 용기있는 사람이 되었고ㅋㅋㅋ 언젠가 꼭 바숔 인피니트를 다시 해야겠다고 마음을 먹게 되었다. 그렇게 몇년이 흘러 아주 무료했던 올해 여름의 어느날 다시 깔아서 게임을 시작했다.  나름 2번째라고 방심해서 난이도 보통으로 했다가 매운 맛 느끼고... 결국 쉬운 맛으로 완주했다. 나처럼 게임에 소질이 없지만 관심이 있는 사람들은 쉬움 난이도로 하면 충분히 깨고도 남는다. 하루에 찔끔찔끔 30분~1시간 정도씩 해서 3주 정도 걸렸다. 하루 중 무료한 순간에 큰 위안이 됐다. 발리건과 불의 어쩌구가 날 끝까지 지켜줬다. 

하여간 힘센데 고집있는 인간이 이상한 사상에 빠졌을 때 주변이 생지옥이 된다는 것을, 진심으로 속죄해본들 돌이킬 수 없는 일들이 있다는 것을, 지금도 게임 속 콜롬비아 같은 세상과 컴스탁 같은 쓰레기 인간이 수없이 존재하다는 것을 다시 깨닫는다. 근데 지금보니 진짜 무서운 사람은 헛소리 하는 그 과학자인 것 같다. 얼굴도 사상도 미친 광기 그자체... 

그래서 후에 안나는 좀 행복해졌을까? 착한 사람은 고통받지 않았음 좋겠다.
I don't really like it.

Не понимаю всех хвалебных дифирамб, воспеваемых этой игре, считаю проект слишком переоценённым. Начнём с геймплея: уровни сложности очень несбалансированные. На среднем уровне игра очень лёгкая и скучная из-за отсутствия челленджа, а на высоком уровне игра начинает раздражать, враги превращаются в губки для впитывания урона - в общем, нет золотой середины. Игровой процесс ничем выдающемся не отличается, местами скучный, шутерная механика мне не понравилось, половина плазмидов (способностей) просто бесполезна. В общем, геймплей слабый середняк. Сюжет неплох, но только в одном случае - вы смотрите его на ютубе, иначе это п***@. Почти весь сюжет и лор раскиданы в журналах и записках и не дай бог вам пропустить лишь одну - вы просто потеряете весь смысл. К середине игры я на сюжет давно забил, ибо невозможно постигать его только через записки - самый халтурный способ рассказать историю. Да и даже если вы посмотрите сюжет на ютубе, будет много незакрытых вопросов без ответа и некоторых сюжетных несостыковок. Единственная положительная сторона игры для меня - красивый воздушный город и некоторые интересные герои. Игру я не рекомендую, скорее всего вы просто её дропнете.

How to fix texture streaming problem:

Open DefaultEngine.ini in notepad. It can be found in your Steam folder under Steam\steamapps\common\BioShoc­k Infinite\XGame\Config\DefaultEngine.ini

Edit to the following and save:

[TextureStreaming]
UseTextureFileCache=False
TexturePoolSizeReductionMB=150­0
PoolSize=3000
LowPCTexturePoolSizeMB=256 

(This game isnt like Bioshock 1 or 2 but still an masterpiece)

I hope this helps you.

[strike]BioShock[/strike] Infinite is so overrated. The gameplay repetitive and too easy, but still fun (except that it gets sooooooo boring omg). The story is nice at first but I didn't like that weird ending and I know a lot of people did, but I didn't. The world is beautiful but kinda linear and empty. Overall it was good at first but I started to get frustrated after a while. It is fun, but has many problems and surely is not a masterpiece like other people tell you about it... I wouldn't recommend it.

Bioshock Infinite is without a doubt the best single-player fps I've ever played and made it into my top 5 favorite games ever. I would also say personal preference aside, this game deserves to be within a top 50 list of best games ever created.

I was immediately pulled in by its cartoony-design, steampunk style and the fact it claimed it was "story-rich", and let me tell you, this game is the furthest thing from a mindless fps. With the smartest story I've ever experienced in a video game(which also features a lot of foreshadowing and plot twists), and will most likely remain in that position for a very long time, it's honestly beyond movie-level material- this story, while confusing with how smart it is, is insane. Once you have finished the campaign once, you will want to replay it almost instantly(which is something I have never felt before), just to experience the craziness and brilliance of this game, pick up on all the foreshadowing and meet the characters again- and if you're genius enough or paying insane attention, you might be able to piece together the ending before it happens on the first playthrough. Not once have I been bored during my second playthrough. It will no doubt leave you with millions of questions but in a good way- because the story is so smart and well thought out, it even lead me to wonder how much messy planning it would take to make a story like this work out so well, to which I say extreme props to them, it can't have been easy at all making such a genius game and one that deserves infinite praise, way more than it gets. (Personally took me quite a long time to hear about this.)

I want to talk about Bioshock Infinite's characters early in the review. Booker Dewitt and Elizabeth are two insanely good characters which you can connect with and adore instantly- with Elizabeth being, without a damn doubt, the best female video game character ever created. They handled her perfectly, with an extremely likeable personality and depth that most people are going to love, believe me, you can't play this game without loving Elizabeth- I can't even begin to fathom how anybody could dislike such a perfectly created character- and actually, her presence in this game was a large reason I even wanted to play it because you can tell she's a great addition before even experiencing this; she offers so much more than just a lacking, damsel-in-distress companion, and a large reason why I hold this game so close to my heart. The character development in this game certainly doesn't stop with the two main protagonists- it extends into every other character in the game including Comstock, Daisy Fitzroy, Lutece Twins, etc who are INSANELY IMPORTANT roles in the story. I don't think there was even one character who doesn't offer something important. Basically, this game beyond excelled at its character designs and stories, not one character irritated me.
As soon as I first saw the Songbird in this game, I fell in love with it, seriously. Something about its design and overall character; absolute perfection and I very much enjoyed its presence for those reasons- I'm also glad that it made "Rescuing Elizabeth" not seem like an easy task.

I wasn't overly sure what to expect when I first began playing, I didn't know what Vigors even were, and it was great to experience being so unaware of how much it actually offers- it surprised me. I didn't expect as much as what this game offers- it out-shined any previous assumptions I had by a long shot. I want to mention the Vigors more though- basically abilities similar to powers in a way, which you will find more of as you play(which were fun to discover to see which the next would offer), giving you many different ways to deal with people and even the machines(with the Possession vigor), and leading you to think more about how to deal with the enemies rather than mindless shooting the entire way through the game- because damn, what an insanely great and fun addition to make this game more unique than an ordinary fps, a little but also huge design and implementation that adds a lot more specialisation to the city of Columbia.
As for the enemies in this game, I didn't expect anything less from a game like this. It has its share of common and rare enemies, the hardest and rarest of which being Handymen which definitely didn't offer a relaxing time to deal with- in fact, on Hard and 1999, were really challenging. The main "Heavy Hitter" enemies in this game for the most part include Patriots, Crows, Firemen and Handymen. You will have to be smart and think about what Vigors will work best against these specifically.

As for Bioshock Infinite's difficulty- play on hard. The game explains its difficulty when you're selecting it, recommending hard for those who are experienced with fps games- but most enemies in Easy are defeated in one hit. I never played on Medium, but Hard seemed like the perfect difficulty for this game. After you complete it the first time around, you will unlock the "1999 Mode", which is the hardest difficulty and one I'm glad they decided to implement, because "Hard" seemed like a title it didn't deserve as it wasn't overly challenging at all except in a couple of places. And of course, you will receive achievements depending on the difficulty level you played it at. 1999 Mode is certainly a challenge, but with enough carefulness you can beat it with pride and limited stress.

As for the achievements in this game. . . perfect. It has its share of difficult and easy ones, none which were overly easy, still requiring some work to get them, and none downright impossible. Absolutely flawless and everything a completionist could ask for to feel satisfied and proud after completing a game perfectly. I couldn't ask for more.

I haven't played the other Bioshock games before, but clearly you don't have to to enjoy this game to its full extent. I know there are some references to previous games, but I would definitely recommend starting with Bioshock Infinite. Finally, to sum it up, this game will touch you personally and emotionally, you will adore it.

[u] [b] !!!SPOILERS!!! [/b] [/u] ONLY READ IF YOU'VE FINISHED THE GAME - There is a plot twist at the end, which the game foreshadows towards, which reveal that Booker and Elizabeth are actually related. I wasn't really a fan of that, while it adds to the story heavily and would mess it up otherwise, I would've liked to have seen a relationship blossom between them and I think everybody probably expected one. Nonetheless it was more of a shock when it happened, the aftermath of that realization isn't too strong.

3 bioshocks + DLC's completados, juegazo saga espectacular sin dudas uno de los mejores juegos de historia que jugué en mi puta vida. es increible la historia todo el chabon q hizo el juego deberia tener un oscar de verdad una puta locura el puto juego este chaval me cago en la ostia tio. el minervas den una historia espectacular me dejo un bajon tan grande por la historia que volvi a recaer en mis drogas antepasadas de xanax, anfetaminas, y mejoralito. gracias a dios supere nuevamente las drogas y me pude unir a una sociedad de fomento para dejar la droga y masturbacion masculina, done el PC a una ONG en busca de frenar la hambruna en Africa y aca ando.--
Uno de los mejores juegos que jugue, historia 10/10, excelentes dlc's

Impresionante simplemente no tengo palabras para describir este pedazo de juego , es cierto que lo eh jugado 8 años luego de su lanzamiento pero las sensaciones son las mismas de cuando logro jugar un juego en su determinado tiempo y forma . Historia Perfecta , luego de jugar los DLC cierra totalmente el circulo , personajes nunca entes vistos , se notan sus motivaciones . Todo esto sumado una gran jugabilidad mejorada desde los anteriores que sirvieron de lienzo para poder expresar la visión de sus proyecciones mentales . Simplemente se lo recomiendo a todo el mundo que ama los videojuegos
